AboutSection.title: About the Event

section1.heading: II IWPPO 2025
section1.paragraph: The IWPPO was born from the need to discuss and find solutions for one of today's greatest environmental challenges: plastic pollution in the oceans. Originating from CEMEIA (Congress on Environmental Studies) and supported by CAPES (PAEP Call) and CNPq, our workshop brings together international experts in an interdisciplinary approach.

section2.heading: Our Approach
section2.paragraph: The workshop combines scientific research, public policies, and technological innovation to address plastic pollution. With participants from various countries, we promote the exchange of knowledge and practical solutions.

highlights: Endorsed by the UN Executive Committee
Aligned with SDG 14 - Life Below Water

RegulamentoSection.title: Work Submission Guidelines
RegulamentoSection.subtitle: Learn the rules and guidelines for submitting works to the II IWPPO

ineditismo.title: Originality
ineditismo.desc: Only unpublished works will be accepted.

modalidades.title: Presentation Formats
modalidades.desc: Participants may present their work in one of the following formats: Oral presentation or E-poster/banner (no physical printing required).

formato.title: Accepted Format
formato.desc: Only expanded abstracts will be accepted.

idiomas.title: Accepted Languages
idiomas.desc: Works may be written in Portuguese, English, or Spanish.

autores.title: Number of Authors/Co-authors
autores.desc: Each work may have up to 6 authors/co-authors (including the main author).

limites.title: Limit of Works per Participant
limites.desc: Main author: up to 2 works; Co-author: up to 5 works.

avaliacao.title: Evaluation Criteria
avaliacao.desc: Works will be evaluated in two stages: (1) preliminary evaluation by the steering committee and (2) evaluation by the Scientific Committee, considering originality, contribution, methodological rigor, writing quality, and classification relative to the state of the art.
avaliacao.escala: Very Poor = 1, Poor = 2, Fair = 3, Good = 4, Very Good = 5. Works with an average score of 4 or higher will be accepted.
avaliacao.resultados: E-poster/banner digital presentation: 1 hour of exhibition (recommended template available on the website). Oral presentation: 10 minutes of presentation + 5 minutes of questions (recommended template available on the website).

criterios: Classification relative to the state of the art

EixosTematicos.envie_trabalho: Submit your work on Doity now

itens.descricao: This thematic area addresses the current state of the oceans in the face of contemporary environmental challenges. It aims to gather studies that assess the health of marine ecosystems, highlighting indicators of environmental degradation, biodiversity loss, acidification, overfishing, and climate change impacts. Research using monitoring tools, ocean modeling, and conservation policy evaluations is also welcome. The goal is to provide a comprehensive and scientific overview of the real condition of the oceans on a local, regional, and global scale.

This area covers research focused on the identification, characterization, and mitigation of pollutants in marine environments, with a special emphasis on emerging contaminants such as microplastics, nanoplastics, pharmaceutical residues, pesticides, and heavy metals. Works investigating sources, dispersion routes, ecotoxicological effects, and potential solutions for these contaminants are expected. Innovative approaches in detection technologies, remediation, and prevention strategies focused on marine sustainability are also included.

itens.titulo: Science with Purpose: Applied Ocean Research
itens.descricao: This area highlights applied science as a strategic tool to address ocean challenges. Research involving remote sensing monitoring, climate modeling, marine biotechnology, and solutions based on emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence and Big Data is welcome. The focus is on producing technical knowledge with a direct impact on conservation, management, and sustainable use of the seas.

This area addresses the importance of traditional knowledge and the role of coastal communities in ocean preservation. It values interdisciplinary studies on sustainable practices, environmental justice, and the impacts of the climate crisis on the lives of indigenous peoples, artisanal fishermen, shellfish gatherers, and riverine communities. It encourages dialogue between science and local knowledge as a strategy for fairer and more effective policies.

This area focuses on the dissemination of scientific knowledge and the strengthening of ocean literacy. It includes initiatives for science popularization, production of educational materials, actions in schools and communities, and communication strategies aimed at social mobilization and support for public policies. Works exploring risk communication in the context of the climate crisis are also expected.

This area explores the role of public policies in the protection and sustainable management of the oceans. It covers topics such as multilateral agreements, the creation of marine protected areas, national legal instruments, participatory governance, and transparency in coastal management. The goal is to articulate science, society, and the state to promote effective and equitable ocean governance.

This area promotes innovative approaches to the regeneration and preservation of marine environments. It includes research on coastal ecosystem restoration, ocean renewable energies, blue economy, sustainable production chains, and nature-based technologies. The objective is to encourage solutions that reconcile socioeconomic development with ecological integrity.

itens.titulo: Oceans and Climate: Interactions and Impacts
itens.descricao: This area analyzes the role of oceans in the global climate system and the effects of climate change on marine and coastal environments. Studies on extreme events, sea level rise, acidification, impacts on vulnerable communities, and mitigation and adaptation strategies are welcome. The emphasis is on understanding and responding to climate risks with a solid scientific basis.

Biagio.palestra: Emergy and Ecological Justice: A New Basis for Shared Responsibility in the Oceans
Biagio.biografia: Biagio F. Giannetti holds a PhD and Master's degree from the University of São Paulo (USP). He began his career at Paulista University (UNIP) in 1992 as an Adjunct Professor and currently holds the position of Full Professor. At UNIP, he coordinated undergraduate programs in chemical engineering and food science (1996-2000) and, since 1998, has been a permanent faculty member in the Graduate Program in Production Engineering (Master's, Doctoral, and Postdoctoral levels), as well as leading research activities at the Production and Environment Laboratory (LaProMA). Since 2005, he has been a leader of a research group registered in the CNPq Research Groups Directory. Between 2016 and 2024, he was a Visiting Professor at Beijing Normal University (China) under the National Program for Recruiting High-Level Foreign Experts. He also served as a Visiting Professor at the University of Sonora (Mexico, 2013 and 2019) and the University of Florence (Italy, 2022). Professor Giannetti is the author of over 300 scientific publications, including books, articles, and conference papers, focusing on production and the environment. His Scopus h-index is 37, and his Google Scholar i10-index is 115. He was President of the International Society for the Advancement of Emergy Research (2023–2025) and is currently an Honorary Council Member and Associate Editor of the Journal of Cleaner Production, Associate Editor of Frontiers in Energy Research, and Global Director and founder of the Advances in Cleaner Production Network.

federico-sulis.palestra: Closing the Cycle: Sustainability Assessment of Cobogós with Marine Plastic Waste
federico-sulis.biografia: Dr. Federico Sulis holds a degree in Natural Sciences from the Università degli Studi di Cagliari (2006), a Master's in Ecotoxicology from the Università degli Studi di Siena (2011), and a specialization in the design and control of ISO 14001 and EMAS environmental management systems from the Tuscany EMAS ECOLABEL School (2014). He recently completed a PhD in Production Engineering at Paulista University (2023). He has experience in Environmental Sciences, with an emphasis on Production Engineering, focusing on Cleaner Production, Industrial Ecology, Ecotoxicology, Sustainable Development, and Waste Recycling. He is currently a postdoctoral researcher at the Production and Environment Laboratory (LAPROMA) of the Graduate Program in Production Engineering (PPEG) at Paulista University (UNIP), where he conducts research in partnership with the Emergy and Ecosystem Resilience Laboratory (LERE) of the Graduate Program in Environmental Systems Analysis (PPGASA) at Cesmac University Center.

Marcell.palestra: Life Cycle Assessment and Microplastics: An Overview
Marcell.biografia: Dr. Marcell Mariano Corrêa Maceno is an Environmental Engineer from the Federal University of Paraná (2007), with a specialization in Quality and Environmental Auditing from the Federal Technological University of Paraná (2010), and a Master's and PhD in Water Resources and Environmental Engineering from the Federal University of Paraná (2010 and 2015). He is currently an Adjunct Professor IV at UFPR in the Production Engineering program, specializing in Environmental Management and Product Design. He coordinates the Graduate Program in Production Engineering (Master's level) at UFPR, the Brazilian Life Cycle Impact Assessment Network (RAICV), and is a member of the Advances in Cleaner Production Network (ACPN). He has been working in environmental management and sustainability since 2008, with current research related to product life cycle assessment, DfX for improving material and energy use, Circular Economy, sustainability assessment of systems, and product circularity assessment.

alireza.instituicao: University of the West of England, United Kingdom; University of Cape Town, South Africa
alireza.palestra: Recycling Plastic Pollution into Construction Solutions for Zero Emission Goals
alireza.biografia: Dr. Alireza Moghayedi is a researcher and educator focused on sustainability, with over 20 years of experience in the Engineering and Built Environment industry. He is a Research Leader in Digital Built Environment at the School of Architecture and Environment at the University of the West of England, Bristol, a senior researcher at the University of Johannesburg, and founder and co-director of S+CUBE at the University of Cape Town. His research focuses on developing inclusive, sustainable, and smart solutions for engineering and built environment infrastructure projects using innovative technologies. He serves as Principal Investigator for several international research projects, collectively valued at over £30 million. His work has been published in leading academic journals and conferences and has received numerous awards for research and teaching. Dr. Moghayedi is an accredited project manager and has held various positions in government agencies, engineering consultancies, and construction and development companies worldwide.

barbara-pinheiro.palestra: Frontiers of Science and Policy in Addressing Plastic Pollution
barbara-pinheiro.biografia: Biologist, Master’s, and PhD in Oceanography from UFPE. Researcher at PACTO MAR | UNIFESP | Maré de Ciências. Member of the Executive Secretariat of the League of Women for the Ocean and the National Committee of the Decade of the Ocean. National Coordinator of Black Women in Ecology, Evolution, and Marine Science.

jemille.palestra: Frontiers of Science and Politics in Facing Plastic Pollution
jemille.biografia: Marine biologist and PhD in Ecology from UFRJ, she works with interdisciplinary research focused on governance, scientific diplomacy, marine conservation, climate change, and ocean pollution. She is part of the UNESCO Chair for Ocean Sustainability and coordinates initiatives such as the Clean Ocean Network and the GT-COP30 of the League of Women for the Ocean. She was Deputy Coordinator of the O20-G20 and an articulator of the National Plastic-Free Ocean Strategy. She serves as a consultant on socio-environmental impact projects, including the Polen Future Waves Program.

jornalista.palestra: Planet or Plastic? - Stories of Journalistic Coverage
jornalista.biografia: Award-winning journalist with over two decades of coverage on environmental issues. She sailed from Oiapoque to Chuí for the Mar sem Fim project. She hosted a radio program on Rádio Eldorado for 10 years and coordinated socio-environmental projects at the station. For two years, she was a field producer in the Javari Valley for documentarian Céline Cousteau. She hosts Vozes do Planeta, a pioneering environmental podcast in Brazil with nine years of history, and the multimedia project Women in Conservation. She is a contributor to O Eco, GO Outside, and National Geographic Brazil and a Pulitzer Center grantee. She is also a co-creator of the League of Women for the Ocean. She is co-director of the documentary Women in Conservation, awarded at the Female Film Festival 2023, best environmental film at the Montreal Women Film Festival and Toronto International Women Film Festival in 2024, and executive producer of the documentary At the Top of the Amazon in Search of New Species, about USP’s unprecedented expedition to Serra do Imeri, western Amazonas.

vazquez.palestra: Planet or Plastic? - Stories of Journalistic Coverage
vazquez.biografia: Dr. Ian Vázquez-Rowe graduated in Biology in 2006 from the University of Texas at Arlington. He then continued his graduate studies in Environmental Engineering at the University of Santiago de Compostela – USC (2006-2008). In October 2008, he began his research career at USC, where he obtained his PhD in Chemical Engineering in July 2012. From January 2012 to December 2013, Dr. Vázquez-Rowe continued his research career as an Environmental Evaluation & Management R&D Engineer at Centre de Recherche Public Henri Tudor (now LIST, in Luxembourg). Currently, Dr. Vázquez-Rowe is a Full Professor at the Department of Engineering at the Pontificia Universidad Católica del Perú. He is also the editor for Ocean Resources and Marine Conservation at the International Journal of Life Cycle Assessment. His main research interests are linked to environmental management, including life cycle methods, their methodological improvement, and their combination with other methods. Moreover, fisheries and agriculture, food systems in general, and waste and wastewater treatment systems, including plastic emissions to water bodies, have been the focus of his research in recent years. In 2021, he was included in the Reuters Hot List of 1000 top climate scientists worldwide, and he annually ranks within the top 2% of researchers in the world according to the University of Stanford.

clemilson.palestra: Athena Platform: Innovation in the Management of Brazilian Research and Scientific Production
clemilson.biografia: Clemilson Marques Batista (CEO). Specialist in graduate program evaluation and higher education public policies, Clemilson Marques Batista has over 25 years of experience in the National Graduate System (SNPG). He worked for eight years in the Evaluation Directorate of CAPES, notably training Pro-Rectors, Coordinators, and technical teams of Graduate Programs across the country. He also served as an advisor in the Pro-Rector’s offices of the Methodist Universities of São Paulo (UMESP) and Piracicaba (UNIMEP), where he was responsible for liaising with CAPES, CNPq, and managing the academic secretariat of Stricto Sensu programs. As the founder and director of JANUS EDUCARE, he provided specialized consulting to dozens of public and private universities, including UFRJ, USP, UNB, UPM, UNICAP, UFSC, and FGV, advising on the creation, reformulation, and evaluation of master’s and doctoral programs, always focusing on CAPES criteria compliance and academic sustainability. He is the creator of the Athena Platform, designed based on his field experience and aimed at the digital transformation of graduate program evaluation and management. He currently leads the strategic expansion of the Athena project, focusing on partnerships, technological validation, and national and international scalability.
